title: Air France-KLM steps up costcutting after losses widen
text:
Save 
Airline group Air France-KLM is to cut capacity and close loss making routes in the wake of a poor first-half performance. 
Operating losses at the group in the period increased by 25% to €232 on revenues of €12.3 billion (+2.4%). 
Chairman Alexandre de Juniac blamed the performance on “exceptional volatility in exchange rates and the fuel price, and by on-going pressure on unit revenues.” 
“The lack of results improvement leads us to implement immediate additional adaptation measures including, in particular, the closure of heavily loss-making routes, the downward revision in capacity for the forthcoming Winter season, together with an acceleration and an increase in the magnitude of our cost-saving initiatives,” de Juniac said.
